Title: Arrow Energy to expand feed gas supplies to QCLNG with Surat gas project expansion
Description: Australia-based Arrow Energy, a joint venture between Shell and PetroChina, has announced plans to develop the second phase of the Surat gas project in Queensland, which will backfill the 8.5 mtpa Queensland Curtis LNG plant, or GCLNG.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks one spot LNG cargo for delivery in October
Description: Thailand’s state-owned has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal on Oct. 15-16. The tender closes on Aug. 15.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche Energy Terminal moves FSRU away from berth at Stade due to dredging work
Description: Terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal has temporarily relocated the 174,000 m3 Energos Force floating storage regasification unit to Outer Elbe and away from its berth at the Stade floating LNG terminal in Elbe port to allow dredging work to take place. The FSRU is expected to return to its berth within the second half of this year.
Author: CK

Title: India’s ONGC signs first framework agreements for LNG deals with Gunvor, ENOC
Description: India’s state-owned upstream firm ONGC has signed its first LNG master sale and purchase agreements with Emirates National Oil Co. and Gunvor, paving the way for the firm to begin importing LNG into India.
Author: CK
